text: The NSW premier has ruled out pill testing at music festivals, despite the deputy state coroner recommending the strategy as a way of saving lives. Glady Berejiklian told Sky News the NSW government “doesn’t believe either legalising drugs, or introducing pill testing is going to prevent deaths”. “We don’t support it and we don’t think it’s the right path to go down,” she said. Labor leader Anthony Albanese said the premier should be open to the recommendation because “young people are losing their lives: and the government needs to “listen to health experts”. Ms Berejiklian will in the meantime move to reinstate a controversial 'festival safety system' after coming under pressure to allow pill testing. She will reintroduce legislation to state parliament, which would force organisers to prepare safety management plans for high-risk events. Under the plan, a licensing fee would be waived for low-risk festivals but others would be forced to pay-up and cover the costs of police and paramedics who are called in to help.
